hours_text:
## Plan Your Visit

Acorn Hall and Morris County Historical Society’s exhibit galleries are open to the public during regular tour hours or by appointment.

##### Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays from 11am–4pm (last tour 3:15pm)  
Sundays from 1pm–4pm (last tour 3:15pm)

The Gallery Gift Shop is open during regular office hours. Holiday schedules may vary.

### Admission

Adults $8  
Seniors $7  
Students $5  
Children under twelve years and members are admitted free.

### Group Tours

Tours for groups of 6 or more can be arranged by appointment. Group tour rates apply. Call 973-267-3465 to inquire.

### The Gardens

The gardens at Acorn Hall are open to the public daily from dawn until dusk. Access to Patriot’s Path can be found at the end of the garden, directly behind Acorn Hall.

### Office Hours

MCHS offices are open Monday–Friday, 8:30AM to 4:30PM.

_Photograph Courtesy of Manfred Saul_

## Acorn Hall Location

Phone: 973-267-3465  
68 Morris Avenue, Morristown, NJ 07960

[Get Directions to Acorn Hall](https://www.google.com/maps/place/68+Morris+Ave,+Morristown,+NJ+07960/@40.7969332,-74.462137,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x89c3a68e9f86417b:0x6a047c41780bc798!8m2!3d40.7969292!4d-74.4599483)

### Memberships

Membership in the Morris County Historical Society is available in a variety of categories from student memberships to lifetime memberships.

##### Member Benefits Include:

  * North American Reciprocal Museum Association membership for Contributors or higher

collections_text:
SINCE 1946 Preserving & Promoting Morris County History  Photograph Courtesy of Manfred Saul 

##### [Acorn Hall will be closed Tuesday, January 20. The gardens and grounds will remain open dawn to dusk.]()

##### []()

##### ABOUT US

## Our Mission

Morris County Historical Society’s mission is to preserve and promote Morris County’s history.

Our recently completed $2 million exterior restoration of Acorn Hall and its 19th-century carriage house illustrates MCHS’s commitment to our mission. MCHS, an independent 501(c)(3) nonprofit, operates Acorn Hall as a historic house museum and furthers our mission through our growing archives and collections as well as exhibitions, public programming, and online content exploring various facets of our rich and diverse local history.

[**Learn More >**](https://morriscountyhistory.org/morris-county-historical-society/)

##### SHOWCASE

## Exhibitions

  * Fermenting a Communal Spirit
  * Designed by Dempsey
  * Morris County Through the Lens of Time
  * The Morristown Sewing School
  * From the Waist Up
  * A Storied Past

#### Fermenting a Communal Spirit

##### Fermenting a Communal Spirit:

#### Morris County Taverns, Speakeasies & Social Clubs

**October 6, 2024 through 2026**

Knock back some history with MCHS to explore the many roles Morris County watering holes served in their communities from the Revolution to the 20th century. In between pints, local establishments across the area were tapped as community centers, military he...
